com.github.jochenw.afw.core.io

Class CircularByteBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jochenw.afw.core.io.CircularByteBuffer

  • public class CircularByteBuffer
extends Object
    A buffer, which doesn't need reallocation of byte arrays, because it reuses a single byte array. This works particularly well, if reading from the buffer takes place at the same time than writing to. Such is the case, for example, when using the buffer within a filtering input stream, like the CircularBufferInputStream.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CircularByteBuffer()
      Creates a new instance with a reasonable default buffer size (8192).
      CircularByteBuffer(int pSize)
      Creates a new instance with the given buffer size.

      • CircularByteBuffer

        public CircularByteBuffer()
        Creates a new instance with a reasonable default buffer size (8192).

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public byte read()
        Returns the next byte from the buffer, removing it at the same time, so that following invocations won't return it again.
        Returns:
        The byte, which is being returned.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - The buffer is empty. Use hasBytes(), or getCurrentNumberOfBytes(), to prevent this exception.

      • read

        public void read(byte[] pBuffer,
                 int pOffset,
                 int pLength)
        Returns the given number of bytes from the buffer by storing them in the given byte array at the given offset.
        Parameters:
        pBuffer - The byte array, where to add bytes.
        pOffset - The offset, where to store bytes in the byte array.
        pLength - The number of bytes to return.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - The byte array pBuffer is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Either of pOffset, or pLength is negative, or the length of the byte array pBuffer is too small.
        IllegalStateException - The buffer doesn't hold the given number of bytes. Use getCurrentNumberOfBytes() to prevent this exception.

      • add

        public void add(byte pByte)
        Adds a new byte to the buffer, which will eventually be returned by following invocations of read().
        Parameters:
        pByte - The byte, which is being added to the buffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - The buffer is full. Use hasSpace(), or getSpace(), to prevent this exception.

      • peek

        public boolean peek(byte[] pBuffer,
                    int pOffset,
                    int pLength)
        Returns, whether the next bytes in the buffer are exactly those, given by pBuffer, pOffset, and pLength. No bytes are being removed from the buffer. If the result is true, then the following invocations of read() are guaranteed to return exactly those bytes.
        Parameters:
        pBuffer - The byte array, which is being searched in the buffer.
        pOffset - The offset of the first byte in the array, that is being searched.
        pLength - The number of bytes in the buffer, which are being searched for.
        Returns:
        True, if the next invocations of read() will return the bytes at offsets pOffset+0, pOffset+1, ..., pOffset+pLength-1 of byte array pBuffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Either of pOffset, or pLength is negative.
        NullPointerException - The byte array pBuffer is null.

      • add

        public void add(byte[] pBuffer,
                int pOffset,
                int pLength)
        Adds the given bytes to the buffer. This is the same as invoking add(byte) for the bytes at offsets pOffset+0, pOffset+1, ..., pOffset+pLength-1 of byte array pBuffer.
        Parameters:
        pBuffer - The byte array, which is being added to the buffer.
        pOffset - The offset of the first byte in the array, that is being added.
        pLength - The number of bytes in the buffer, which are being added.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - The buffer doesn't have sufficient space. Use getSpace() to prevent this exception.
        IllegalArgumentException - Either of pOffset, or pLength is negative.
        NullPointerException - The byte array pBuffer is null.

      • hasSpace

        public boolean hasSpace()
        Returns, whether there is currently room for a single byte in the buffer. Same as hasSpace(1).
        Returns:
        True, if there is room for at least one more byte in the buffer.
        See Also:
        hasSpace(int), getSpace()

      • hasSpace

        public boolean hasSpace(int pBytes)
        Returns, whether there is currently room for the given number of bytes in the buffer.
        Parameters:
        pBytes - The number of bytes
        Returns:
        True, if there is room for at least the given number of bytes in the buffer.
        See Also:
        hasSpace(), getSpace()

      • hasBytes

        public boolean hasBytes()
        Returns, whether the buffer is currently holding, at least, a single byte.
        Returns:
        True, if there is at least one byte in the buffer.

      • getSpace

        public int getSpace()
        Returns the number of bytes, that can currently be added to the buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes, that can be added to the buffer.

      • getCurrentNumberOfBytes

        public int getCurrentNumberOfBytes()
        Returns the number of bytes, that are currently present in the buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes, that are currently present in the buffer.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all bytes from the buffer.
